body_html:
At this point we want to keep the APIs as simple as possible. This often doesn't limit their flexibility and makes it easier for people to learn the framework. Also, if we introduce functions/arguments that are not going to be very useful it might be hard to deprecate and remove them later, so it has to be done with care.

For example, adding the hidden states is only a matter of calling one method on the output, so I don't think it's worth extending the API. You can add it in as many characters, as it would take you to specify a different merge mode, and it will be immediately clear what you wanted to do.
